intro: Saccolabiopsis bakhuizenii, commonly known as the African moon cactus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to purple. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
